alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued September 01 at 4:50PM PDT until September 01 at 6:15PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 615 PM PDT. * At 448 PM PDT, blowing dust associated with thunderstorms producing wind gusts to 50 MPH was lowering the visibility to below 1/4 mile. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility. SOURCE...Spotter reports and doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Interstate 10 near Palm Springs will be the most greatly affected. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Indio, northern Palm Springs, Mt San Jacinto State Park, Cathedral City, Palm Desert, Desert Hot Springs, Rancho Mirage, North Palm Springs, Whitewater, Sky Valley, Thousand Palms, and Bermuda Dunes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
